intro: Aspidopterys glabriuscula var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a distinctive evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 15 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically dark green and can grow to lengths of over 3 meters. The plant is well adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
